pages.text: Ascoceras is a unique orthoceratoid cephalopod from the Ordivician to Silurian. It is most known for its ontogeny. Juvenile Ascoceras sport a long and circular shell that sheds apart as the creature grows. For this reason, the juvenile shell is known as a deciduous conch. A fully mature ascoceroid conch consists of dorsal chambers. Ascoceras are found across Europe and North America.
$(l)Eats:$() Fish Food$(br)$(l)Breeds with:$() Fish Food$(br)$(l)Egg Type:$() Drops Egg$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Kill for Egg/Bucket
